jobsJson.descriptionPlain:
At Gojek, we want people applying to us to have a great experience throughout the process. We also want to quickly and effectively identify the best among them so we can hire them, while ensuring that our interview panelists are able to utilize their valuable time, well. 

Given our extremely exacting standards of hiring, achieving this requires strong communication skills and deep commitment. Outside-the-box problem-solving skills are essential. 

Expectations: Shortening time between touch points with candidates. 
Shortening overall time from the first conversation to offer/rejection.
Using Gojek interview panelists time and effort: Better scheduling and better communication of candidate interview history with Gojek panellists.
Analyze data and identify what’s working and what isn’t and feed that into the improvement process.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

lists.content:
• Consult with leaders/recruiters to understand the staffing requirements and specific job objectives.
  • Communicate about the company and job with relevant candidates.
  • Manage the ATS and keep it up to date.
  • Coordinate and maintain calendar invites for Skype, T-con and in-person interviews.
  • Follow up with the candidates for code submissions and set up calls with panels whenever necessary.
  • Maintain a complete record (Excel Sheets) of interviews and sourcing trends.
  • Stay up-to-date with current recruiting methods.

• 1 - 4 year’s work experience as a recruitment coordinator for technology positions.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and complete projects within deadline.
  • Good understanding about various tech stacks. Familiarity with one or more HR databases, applicant tracking systems and candidate management systems.
  • Familiarity with social media hiring. Good sourcing knowledge through various job portals.
